name: Appointment Management
description: Core appointment management system enabling users to create, view, edit, and delete appointments with overlap detection, multiple view options, and role-based access for Admin, Single, and Team users.

userStories.title: Project Setup and Database Schema
userStories.description: As a developer I want the project initialized with the tech stack and database schema So that I can build features on a solid foundation
acceptanceCriteria: React.js frontend initialized with Material-UI and TypeScript
Appointments table created with: id, title, description, start_time, end_time, timezone, user_id, created_at, updated_at
Users table created with: id, email, name, role (admin/single/team), team_id, created_at
Teams table created with: id, name, created_at
userStories.technicalNotes: Use UTC for all timestamp storage. Use ISO 8601 format for API responses. Set up ESLint and Prettier.

userStories.title: Create Appointment API Endpoint
userStories.description: As a user I want to create a new appointment via API So that I can add events to my schedule
acceptanceCriteria: Validates required fields: title, start_time, end_time

userStories.title: Read Appointments API Endpoints
userStories.description: As a user I want to retrieve my appointments via API So that I can view my schedule
acceptanceCriteria: Respects user ownership (users only see their own)

userStories.title: Update Appointment API Endpoint
userStories.description: As a user I want to update an existing appointment via API So that I can modify my schedule

userStories.title: Delete Appointment API Endpoint
userStories.description: As a user I want to delete an appointment via API So that I can remove events from my schedule
userStories.technicalNotes: Soft delete vs hard delete decision (recommend soft delete).

userStories.title: Overlap Detection Service
userStories.description: As a user I want to be warned about scheduling conflicts So that I don't accidentally double-book
acceptanceCriteria: Service detects overlapping appointments for same user
API returns overlap warnings in response
Blocked by default, but accepts ?force=true to override
userStories.technicalNotes: Check: new_start < existing_end AND new_end > existing_start.

userStories.title: Appointment Form Component
userStories.description: As a user I want a form to create/edit appointments So that I can manage my schedule through the UI
acceptanceCriteria: Form with fields: title, description, start date/time, end date/time, timezone
Submit creates new appointment via API

userStories.title: Overlap Warning Dialog
userStories.description: As a user I want to see a warning when my appointment overlaps with existing ones So that I can decide whether to proceed or modify

userStories.title: Appointments List View
userStories.description: As a user I want to see my appointments in a list So that I can quickly scan my schedule
acceptanceCriteria: List displays appointments sorted by date
Shows title, date, time for each appointment

userStories.title: Appointment Detail View
userStories.description: As a user I want to view full details of an appointment So that I can see all information
acceptanceCriteria: Edit button navigates to edit form

userStories.title: Calendar View Component
userStories.description: As a user I want to see my appointments in a calendar view So that I can visualize my schedule over time
acceptanceCriteria: Click on date shows appointments for that day
Click on appointment opens detail view
userStories.technicalNotes: Consider FullCalendar library or build custom with Material-UI.

userStories.title: Calendar Week and Day Views
userStories.description: As a user I want week and day views in the calendar So that I can see detailed time slots
acceptanceCriteria: Week view shows 7-day grid with time slots
Day view shows single day with time slots

userStories.title: Drag and Drop Rescheduling
userStories.description: As a user I want to drag appointments to reschedule them So that I can quickly adjust my schedule
acceptanceCriteria: Drag appointment to new date in calendar
Drag to new time slot in week/day view
userStories.technicalNotes: Use react-beautiful-dnd or native drag API.

userStories.title: View Toggle Navigation
userStories.description: As a user I want to switch between List and Calendar views So that I can choose my preferred visualization
acceptanceCriteria: Persists view preference in local storage

userStories.title: User Role - Admin Access
userStories.description: As an admin I want to view and manage all users' appointments So that I can oversee the entire organization
acceptanceCriteria: Admin can view all appointments across users
Filter by user in list/calendar views
Role check middleware on API endpoints

userStories.title: User Role - Team Visibility
userStories.description: As a team user I want to see my team members' appointments So that I can coordinate schedules
acceptanceCriteria: Team members see each other's appointments (read-only)
Visual distinction between own and team appointments

userStories.title: Timezone Display and Selection
userStories.description: As a user I want to view appointments in my local timezone So that times are meaningful to me
acceptanceCriteria: User can set preferred timezone in settings
userStories.technicalNotes: Use date-fns-tz or luxon for timezone handling. Store in UTC, display in local.
